definition:
a product of plant growth (such as grain, vegetables, or cotton)                                      
             
             the fruits of the field
the usually edible reproductive body of a seed plant
a succulent (see succulent entry 1 sense 1c) plant part (such as the petioles (see petiole sense 1) of a rhubarb plant) used chiefly in a dessert or sweet course

a dish, quantity, or diet of fruits                                      
             
             live on fruit
a product of fertilization (see fertilization sense b) in a plant with its modified envelopes or appendages

the flavor or aroma of fresh fruit in mature wine                                      
             
             The wine's fruit is rich in tangerine, apricot, and papaya flavors.

offspring, progeny                                      
             
             the fruit of the womb

the state of bearing fruit                                      
             
             a tree in fruit

the effect or consequence of an action or operation : product, result                                      
             
             the fruits of our labor

a gay person                                      
                
                  —used as a term of abuse and disparagement
to bear fruit
to cause to bear fruit
a usually sweet food (such as a blueberry, orange, or apple) that grows on a tree or bush
the part of a plant that has the seeds in it (such as the pod of a pea, a nut, a grain, or a berry)
a result or reward that comes from some action or activity
to produce fruit
a usually soft and juicy plant part (as rhubarb, a strawberry, or an orange) that is often eaten as a dessert and is distinguished from a vegetable

a product of fertilization in a seed plant that consists of the ripened ovary of a flower with its included seeds                                      
             
             Apples, cucumbers, nuts, and blueberries are all fruits.

result entry 2 sense 1, product                                      
             
             You can enjoy the fruits of your labors.
to bear or cause to bear fruit
a product of fertilization in a plant with its modified envelopes or appendages

something (as evidence) that is obtained or gathered during an action or operation (as a search)                                      
             
             moved to suppress evidence seized from the room on the grounds that it was obtained as the fruit of an illegal arrest

fruit of the poisonous tree                                      
             
             the Court was asked to extend the…fruit doctrine

property (as income or goods) produced by or derived from other movable or immovable property without diminution of its substance                                      
             
             co-owners share the fruits and products of the thing held
the revenue derived from property especially by virtue of an obligation (as a lease)
an animal or plant product (as a crop)
income that is produced or earned by other property or services
in: the fruits of the field
the fruit of the tree
live on fruit
The wine's fruit is rich in tangerine, apricot, and papaya flavors.
the fruit of the womb
a tree in fruit
the fruits of our labor
the fruits of victory
apples, oranges, and other fruits
one fruit of your faithfulness in carrying out your duties will be more rewarding responsibilities
When will the trees fruit?
Apples, cucumbers, nuts, and blueberries are all fruits.
You can enjoy the fruits of your labors.
a fruited plant
moved to suppress evidence seized from the room on the grounds that it was obtained as the fruit of an illegal arrest
the Court was asked to extend the…fruit doctrine
co-owners share the fruits and products of the thing held

definition: a type of food that grows on trees or plants. It tastes sweet and contains seeds or a stone. Apples and oranges are fruit. Ripe fruit is ready to eat
made from fruit, or relating to fruit
the part of a tree or plant that contains its seeds
an offensive word for a man who is gay
in: Peaches are my favourite fruit.
fresh/dried/tinned fruit: Eat plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables.
a piece of fruit  (=one apple, orange etc): She always has a piece of fruit for dessert.
a fruit tree
fruit juice/yoghurt: Would you like water or fruit juice?
a shrub with white flowers and small red fruits
bear fruit
the fruit/fruits of something
the fruits of nature/the earth
in fruit
old fruit

definition: the soft part containing seeds that is produced by a plant. Many types of fruit are sweet and can be eaten:
the part of any plant that holds the seeds
the pleasant or successful result of work or actions:
a gay man. Many people consider this word offensive.
When a plant fruits, it produces fruit:
an edible and usually sweet product of a plant or tree that contains seeds or a pit (= large hard seed):
Fruit is also the part of a plant that contains the seed from which a new plant can grow.
the result of work or actions, esp. if pleasant or successful:
in: Apricots are the one fruit I don't like.
Oranges, apples, pears, and bananas are all types of fruit.
Would you like some fruit for dessert?
The cherry tree in our garden is in fruit (= it has fruit growing on it).
I like exotic fruit, like mangoes and papayas.
How many pieces of fresh fruit do you eat in a day?
fruit trees
He runs a fruit and vegetable stall in the market.
This book is the fruit of 15 years' research.
It's been hard work, but now the business is running smoothly you can sit back and enjoy the fruits of your labours.
Over the last few years, our apple trees have been fruiting much earlier than usual.
We eat a lot of fruits and vegetables at our house.
I usually eat a piece of fresh fruit with my lunch.
The fruits of economic growth are starting to make a difference in the lives of many workers.

translated_as@fr: Les fruits frais sont un bon en-cas.
les agrumes tels que les oranges
les fruits du système démocratique vieux de 30 ans du pays

definition:
1. some one who is a flaming flamboyant homosexual

2. a very tasty edible snack, in which one might find a nice sweet pleasure from

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
Homo, gay.
Homosexual, gay.

A magazine established in 1997 in Japan by Japanese photographer Shoichi Aoki.  Also a photobook.

It showcases the trend of wild street fashions in Harajuku district of Tokyo.

Many Westerners call FRUiTS a fashion ("Being FRUiTS-y", or just "FRUiTS"), but it is only a magazine with many types of styles.  Decora is often mistaken for this "style", as it has a large showcase in the book "FRUiTS".

These styles include Lolita, Decora, Gyaru/Ganguro, Second-hand fashion/Bohemian, Garage style, British Punk, and many more.
A gay guy. He's not exactly gay, but just womanly enough to be gay.
A flamboyant homosexual male, often recognised by his mince, garish clothing and/or flagrant love of man beef.
